title: Application of Granular Biocomposites Based on Homogenised Peat for Absorption of Oil Products
summary: This paper investigates the use of granular biocomposites made from homogenized peat, devulcanised rubber, and cenospheres for oil product absorption. The study focuses on the material's properties, such as hydrophobicity, porosity, and sorption capacity, but does not involve any machine learning or artificial intelligence methods.
methodology: The authors used a combination of experimental techniques, including scanning electron microscopy (SEM), X-ray micro-computed tomography (microCT), and digital microscopy to study the material's properties. They also performed sorption capacity tests using diesel fuel and motor oil.
research_outcomes: The study found that the granular biocomposites have a high sorption capacity for oil products, with up to 1.55 g·g−1 sorption capacity for diesel fuel. The authors also observed that the material's hydrophobicity and porosity play important roles in its sorption properties.

title: Robust Identification of Strain Waves due to Low-Velocity Impact with Different Impactor Stiffness
summary: This paper focuses on the development of an automated impact monitoring system for aeronautical structures. The authors investigate the effects of different impactor stiffnesses on strain wave generation and velocity, aiming to reduce their influence on impact-related features. Signal processing techniques are used to extract features from dynamic strain signals acquired using sensor networks.
methodology: Experimental setup involves choosing representative aeronautical structures (metallic plate and sandwich panel) and adopting classical sensor technologies to acquire dynamic strain signals. The authors process the signals to assess strain wave velocity and evaluate the possibility of extracting unique features for each specimen.
research_outcomes: The study demonstrates the importance of considering impactor stiffness in impact identification and proposes a method to reduce its influence on impact-related features.

title: The Influence of the Chamber Configuration on the Hydrodynamic Efficiency of Oscillating Water Column Devices
summary: This paper evaluates the influence of the front wall thickness on the hydrodynamic performance of Oscillating Water Column (OWC) devices. The study uses numerical results and compares them with literature values, finding good agreement. The research focuses on the design and construction of OWCs, particularly in breakwaters, and aims to improve their efficiency.
methodology: The potential flow approach was used via the boundary element method (BEM) to analyze the effects of front wall thickness and chamber bottom configurations on OWC device efficiency.
research_outcomes: The study found that a thinner front wall can increase the efficiency band, but may compromise structural integrity. The design of the chamber and power take-off system is crucial for optimal performance.

title: An Efficient Stochastic Constrained Path Planner for Redundant Manipulators
summary: This paper proposes a novel stochastic method to efficiently plan collision-free trajectories for redundant manipulators. The approach exploits the kinematics of mechanisms with redundant actuation and maximizes manipulability while avoiding obstacles, providing smooth trajectories that can be directly commanded to the robot.
methodology: The proposed method uses a stochastic algorithm to generate collision-free trajectories by exploiting the null-space at each configuration along the path to maximize manipulability. It handles kinematic restrictions exactly and does not rely on discretization of task space or configuration space.
research_outcomes: The proposed method delivers fitting experimental performance for challenging motion problems, providing smooth trajectories that can be directly commanded to the robot without the need for posterior smoothing phase.

title: Overcurrent relay coordination with grid-connected and islanding capability on distribution network with distributed generation
summary: This paper proposes a method to establish overcurrent relay settings that coordinate correctly for both grid-connected and islanding conditions on distribution networks with distributed generation. The proposed method is based on the idea that a single setting can work for both conditions, and it has been successfully implemented in a case study.
methodology: The proposed method involves finding a compromise between the settings for grid-connected and islanding conditions using a flowchart-based approach. The method starts with the setting for grid-connected condition and then creates a new setting based on the islanding condition if necessary.
research_outcomes: The proposed method has successfully established a setting that works correctly for both grid-connected and islanding conditions in a case study.

title: Performance of Composite Shear Walls Subjected to In-plane Cyclic Loading-A Numerical Parametric Study
summary: This paper investigates the performance of composite shear walls under in-plane cyclic loading through a numerical parametric study. The research focuses on evaluating the behavior and comparing the performance of different types of composite shear walls, including RC shear walls, composite shear walls with single or double external steel plates, and other configurations.
methodology: Numerical finite element analysis using ABAQUS software
research_outcomes: The study found that the wall4 has the best performance among all four types of shear walls, with an energy absorption capacity approximately two times greater than that of other configurations.
sources_of_inspiration: Rafiei et al. [7] and Hossain et al. [8]

title: Optimal Placement of FACTS Devices Based on Whale Optimization Algorithm for Power System Security Enhancement
summary: This paper presents a methodology to enhance the security of power systems by optimally placing FACTS devices using the Whale Optimization Algorithm. The method analyzes system security based on loading of transmission lines and variations of bus voltages, and combines security constraints with Optimal Power Flow to resolve this problem.
methodology: The methodology uses a metaheuristic technique, Whale Optimization Algorithm (WOA), to solve the optimal power flow problem in the presence of FACTS devices. The WOA's performance is better than state-of-the-art meta-heuristic and conventional algorithms.
research_outcomes: The paper presents an index called Line Overload Severity Index (LOSI) to identify the most critical line in a given system, and evaluates the LOSI value under various load conditions. The optimal location for UPFC device can be determined based on the LOSI value.

title: Demand Response Contextual Remuneration of Prosumers with Distributed Storage
summary: This paper proposes a methodology to optimally manage community resources, including distributed generation and energy storage systems. The authors aim to address fair and contextual remuneration of prosumers participating in demand response events, reducing uncertainty and improving self-consumption.
methodology: The proposed methodology involves optimizing prosumer behavior using past DR events to predict and classify their response, evaluating several approaches for increasing remuneration fairness, and comparing energy price schemes from the community manager and prosumer perspectives.
research_outcomes: The authors' results show that it was possible to improve the fairness of the remuneration, which is an incentive and compensation for the loss of comfort. The single fair remuneration approach was more beneficial to the community manager, since the total remuneration was lower than the remaining approaches.

title: Comparative analysis and experimental results of advanced control strategies for vibration suppression in aircraft wings
summary: This paper presents a comparative analysis of two active vibration control methods, Linear Quadratic Regulator and Fractional Order Proportional Derivative controller, for suppressing vibrations in aircraft wings. The study focuses on the experimental results and settling times obtained using these controllers.
methodology: The authors present a tuning method for two controllers: Linear Quadratic Regulator and Fractional Order Proportional Derivative controller. The dynamics of the smart beam is considered as a simple second-order system, allowing for robustness to be addressed.
research_outcomes: The study shows that both types of controllers can successfully reduce oscillations in aircraft wings. The Fractional Order Proportional Derivative controller outperforms the classical PID controller.

title: Fault Detection Method for Permanent Magnet Synchronous Generator Wind Energy Converters Using Correlation Features Among Three-phase Currents
summary: This paper presents a fault detection method for permanent magnet synchronous generator (PMSG) wind energy converters using correlation features among three-phase currents. The proposed method uses an artificial neural network (ANN) trained by the features extracted from motor currents and the DC-link current to detect open-circuit faults (OCFs) in PMSG drives at different wind speeds.
methodology: The proposed method uses a correlation feature identification approach, which extracts features by considering the balance among three-phase currents. The ANN is trained using these features to detect OCFs.
research_outcomes: The results show that the proposed method can detect OCFs in both single and double switches for PMSG drives at different wind speeds with a diagnostic rate greater than 99.4%.

title: A Review on Augmentation of Voltage Stability Using Optimization Technique
summary: This paper reviews the importance of voltage stability and optimal reactive power dispatch in power systems, discussing traditional and advanced optimization techniques. The authors propose a review of LP Technique and PSO algorithm for system parameters development to improve voltage stability and profile improvement.
methodology: The authors use linear programming (LP) and particle swarm optimization (PSO) algorithms to optimize reactive power dispatch and improve voltage stability in power systems.
research_outcomes: The study shows that PSO algorithm is more efficient and better than LP technique for optimizing the objective function (ΣL^2) for IEEE 39 bus system.

title: Data-based PID control of flexible joint robot using adaptive safe experimentation dynamics algorithm
summary: This paper proposes a data-based PID controller for flexible joint robots using the adaptive safe experimentation dynamics (ASED) algorithm. The ASED algorithm is an enhanced version of the SED algorithm, which improves convergence accuracy by adapting to changes in the objective function.
methodology: The proposed method uses a data-based approach to design PID controllers for flexible joint robots. The ASED algorithm is used to find the optimal PID parameters that minimize the control objective function.
research_outcomes: The results show that the proposed data-based PID controller using ASED outperforms the conventional SED method in terms of control accuracy.

title: Free-hand gas identification based on transfer function ratios without gas flow control
summary: This paper presents a novel gas identification protocol based on transfer function ratios (TFR) that is intrinsically independent of the gas input pattern. The protocol, combined with MEMS-based sensors, enables free-hand gas identification without gas flow control units, expanding the applicability of gas sensors to portable electronics.
methodology: The methodology involves combining a novel gas identification protocol based on TFR with MEMS-based sensors. The TFR is calculated from sensing signals obtained through free-hand measurement, allowing for gas species identification without the need for gas flow control units.
research_outcomes: Highly accurate machine learning models can identify odors of spices and herbs as well as solvent vapors using the proposed protocol. The compact measurement system enables practical artificial olfaction.

title: Numerical simulation and experimental investigation of submersible sewage mixer performance
summary: This paper presents an experimental and numerical investigation of submersible sewage mixer performance. The authors focus on evaluating the efficiency of a submersible mixer using both theoretical and numerical methods, comparing their results with experimental data. Machine learning or AI techniques are not used in this research.
methodology: The methodology involves an experimental setup to measure thrust, torque rotation speed, and electric power, as well as a numerical simulation using CFD Ansys FLUENT software to analyze the operation of the submersible mixer.
research_outcomes: The study presents performance data from experiment and CFD simulation, allowing other researchers to compare their results with a known and validated solution. The authors also discuss the limitations of current design methods for submersible mixers and propose further research in this area.

title: Artificial Neural Network and Response Surface Methodology Based Analysis on Solid Particle Erosion Behavior of Polymer Matrix Composites
summary: This paper investigates the erosion behavior of polymer matrix composites using a combination of response surface methodology and artificial neural networks. The study demonstrates how machine learning can be used to model complex material phenomena, with the ANN model showing good agreement with experimental results.
methodology: The paper uses a Box-Behnken design for experimental planning and a second-order polynomial regression model for correlation of erosion in terms of coded parameters. The artificial neural network model is used to validate the attained outcomes for an optimum solution.
research_outcomes: The study shows that the impingement angle was the most significant erosion parameter for the solid particle jet erosion process. The combined effect of machining parameters on erosion is also investigated.

title: A Novel Method for Effective Cell Segmentation and Tracking in Phase Contrast Microscopic Images
summary: This paper presents a novel method for effective cell segmentation and tracking in phase contrast microscopic images. The proposed method uses the K-means clustering technique to eliminate the halo effect, which interferes with precise segmentation of cell shapes. The method is verified by comparing it with manual tracking results and state-of-the-art unsupervised methods.
methodology: The proposed method uses a combination of noise reduction using block-matching 3D filtering, k-means clustering to mitigate the halo signal, and active contours for cell boundary detection.
research_outcomes: The proposed method achieves lower error rates compared to conventional active contour methods and state-of-the-art unsupervised methods.

title: Appliance-Level Monitoring with Micro-Moment Smart Plugs
summary: This paper proposes a micro-moment-based smart plug system for energy efficiency, which collects contextual information and enables real-time power measurements. The system is part of the broader (EM ) 3 project that uses artificial intelligence to achieve high domestic energy performance.
methodology: The proposed system combines energy tracking at the device level with environmental details of the current household space, using a micro-moment-based approach.
research_outcomes: The system delivers cost-effective deployment while maintaining adequate computation and wireless performance.

title: Power System Small-Signal Stability as Affected by Grid-Connected SmartPark
summary: This paper examines the impact of grid-connected smart charging stations on power system small-signal stability. The authors employ damping torque analysis to investigate the effects of smart charging station integration on transmission system dynamics, finding that optimal charging capacity is crucial for maintaining dynamic stability.
methodology: Damping Torque Analysis (DTA) and linearized models
research_outcomes: The study reveals the importance of considering optimal charging capacity in smart charging station design to ensure power system small-signal stability.

title: Forecasting Short-term load using Econometrics time series model with T-student Distribution
summary: This paper focuses on short-term load forecasting, a crucial aspect of electrical system planning and dispatching. The authors propose an Autoregressive integrated moving average (SARIMA) - generalized autoregressive conditional heteroskedasticity (GARCH) model with T-student Distribution to forecast electric load for one day ahead. Although the paper uses econometrics time series models, which are not typically considered machine learning or AI methods, it does not explicitly mention any ML/AI techniques.
methodology: The authors use real electricity load data from the Electric Reliability Council of Texas (ERCOT) and apply various econometrics time series models to forecast electric load. They compare their proposed SARIMA-GARCH model with the ARIMA model and validate its effectiveness using real data.
statistics: time series regression, Augmented Dickey-Fuller test, McLeod-Li test
research_outcomes: The authors demonstrate that their proposed SARIMA-GARCH model outperforms the ARIMA model in forecasting electric load for one day ahead. They also show that the model can handle non-stationary and heteroscedastic data.

title: Experimental Analysis of Modified DC-P&O Technique with Arm Controller for a Stand-Alone 40 W PV System
summary: This paper presents an experimental analysis of a modified direct-control perturbation & observation (DC-P&O) technique for a stand-alone 40 W photovoltaic system. The authors focus on improving the efficiency of solar cells by proposing a modified DC-P&O method using an efficient DC-DC boost convertor and an intelligent, efficient and low-cost 32-bit ARM Cortex microcontroller.
methodology: The methodology involves step-by-step discussion of the workflow, including the use of a block diagram to help learners understand the overall process. The authors propose a modified DC-P&O technique using an efficient DC-DC boost convertor and an intelligent, efficient and low-cost 32-bit ARM Cortex microcontroller.
research_outcomes: The proposed modified DC-P&O technique enhances the efficiency of the controller by 84.48% for real-time parameters of the PV panel at maximum power point (MPP) for a 57% duty ratio.

title: Sequential Algorithm for Combined State of Charge and State of Health Estimation of Lithium Ion Battery based on Active Current Injection
summary: This paper proposes a sequential algorithm for estimating the state of charge (SoC) and state of health (SoH) of lithium-ion batteries using active current injection. The algorithm uses frequency-scale separation to estimate parameters/states sequentially, improving estimation performance compared to concurrent algorithms.
methodology: The proposed sequential algorithm consists of three main steps: estimating the ohmic resistance Rs independently by injecting a high-frequency current and incorporating a high-pass filter; characterizing the RC pair by injecting a medium-frequency current based on the estimated Rs; and estimating the battery capacity and SoC concurrently.
research_outcomes: The proposed sequential algorithm significantly increases estimation accuracy compared to concurrent algorithms. Experimental results verify its effectiveness for various battery capacities.

title: High Density Resistive Array Readout System for Wearable Electronics
summary: This paper presents a wearable sensing system for high-density resistive array readout, which measures the resistance change of sensors using a custom graphical user interface. The system consists of a readout board and a battery housed in a wristband chassis.
methodology: The methodology involves collecting and multiplexing sensor output, processing it using an analog-to-digital converter, and sending the converted data to a PC or smartphone.
research_outcomes: The system shows promising results for applications in IoT, point-of-care testing, and low-cost wearable devices.

title: Assessment of Rough Set Theory in Relation to Risks Regarding Hydraulic Engineering Investment Decisions
summary: This paper assesses the application of rough set theory in hydraulic engineering investment decisions, proposing innovations for optimizing water conservancy project investment decision-making. The study uses rough set theory to analyze imprecise and uncertain information, discovering hidden knowledge that can be used to discover potential rules.
methodology: Rough set theory is applied to analyze various kinds of imprecise, inconsistent, uncompleted, or imperfect information from which it can find hidden knowledge that can be used to discover a potential rule.
research_outcomes: The study proposes the application of rough set theory in the optimization of water conservancy project investment decision-making, providing a scientific basis for water conservancy project investment decision-making. The data processed by the rough set method are discrete, and unlike other methods, this theory can solve the discrete phenomenon of data.

title: Prediction and evaluation of photovoltaic-thermal energy systems production using artificial neural network and experimental dataset
summary: This paper presents a novel mathematical and ANN model for examining the performance of PV/T systems, with a focus on predicting and assessing photovoltaic-thermal energy system production using artificial neural network models based on an experimental dataset in Sohar/Oman. The proposed neural models can generate future figures for any needed period that accurately fit the actual datasets.
methodology: The study used a combination of mathematical and ANN models to examine the performance of PV/T systems, with experimental data collected from Sohar/Oman. The proposed neural models were trained using an experimental dataset and validated using descriptive statistics and Evaluation Metrics.
research_outcomes: The results show that the proposed ANN model can accurately predict and assess PV/T system production, with improved performance compared to conventional methods. The study highlights the potential of ANN models in examining the performance of PV/T systems.

title: Electrical Modification and Experimental Study of Combine Harvester Reaping Unit
summary: This paper focuses on the electrical modification of a combine harvester reaping unit to improve efficiency and reduce labor requirements. The research team proposes an electric refit for the reaping unit, including the selection of motor and reducer, 3D design, and finite element analysis. However, machine learning or artificial intelligence methods are not used in this study.
methodology: The methodology involves electrical modification of the reaping unit, including structural modifications, selection and design of motor and reducer, overall layout and mounting method, shaft connection method, external dimension comparison, finite element analysis, and multi-motor speed following based on PLC.
research_outcomes: The study demonstrates the feasibility of electrical modification for combine harvester reaping units, providing a theoretical basis and experimental data for robotics research in this area.
